value.0: I... I don't know what happened... I placed those Irilium Crystals you gave me into my constructs, and they all simply died on me... Must have been a miscalculation on my part, I suppose.

Still, considering the fact that the invaders now have the Control Stone in their grasp, that might be a good thing. After all, whoever controls the Control Stone controls the constructs. They would have become our own worst enemies!

<StartAction>[Janthos' eyes have grown wide with terror, his small hands shaking visibly.]</Start> I... I have never seen such a thing before... So... so much blood... Not since... Oh gosh, <FirstName>, it's like my parents' murder all over again!
The... the invaders took over the Control Stone, <FirstName>... My... my constructs have now been turned against us...
The... the constructs turned on us, <FirstName>... They... they started... started ripping people apart... limb by limb... I... oh... I... it was so terrible...
Oh what have I done! What have I done! <StartAction>[Janthos begins jabbering softly, and you decide now would be a good time to leave.]</Start>

<StartAction>[The Gnome seems to calm a bit.]</Start> I... I suppose you're right, <FirstName>... Thank... thank you... It'll be all right... We'll be okay... At least Alia and her parents got out in time.

What... what's this? I... I hadn't thought of that... I do indeed still have those Irilium Crystals! I experimented with them a bit, and while I haven't had a chance to test them out in full, the crystals should work.
There's only three of them, and you'll have to overpower each construct to use them, but it just might allow us to overcome the Control Stone's influence over my treacherous creations.

Here, take them, <FirstName>. When you have defeated a construct, simply place one of the crystals in the small socket upon its back and rotate it to the left. That should power it back up and free it from whoever's running the Control Stone.
Please see if you can regain the help of the constructs. I think they will prove quite useful to you and Captain Anagril!
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 1. >>
I wish we could speak further, <FirstName>, but I must get to work on these constructs. With your help, it looks as though I will be able to complete my work here much earlier than I had anticipated!

<StartAction>[Janthos glances up as you approach, his face stained with grease.]</Start> Hello there, <FirstName>. Have you found any of those Irilium Crystals yet? I certainly could use them right about now...
Ah, most excellent! These are just what I need! Now I can finally finish my work on these constructs! Give me a bit more time, <FirstName>, and I can assure that the results will be amazing!
Yes, yes, of course! Where are my manners? You do deserve a little payment for aiding me in this endeavor.
Don't worry about me, <FirstName>. I've recited all the proper rituals, and the protection glyphs are in place to prevent any accidents from occurring should my fingers suddenly grow clumsy.
Here, I set aside 100 gold pieces to reimburse you for the effort. If there's any money left over, call it yours, my friend. Maybe tonight we'll go down to celebrate at the Ravenclaw.

How noble of you, <FirstName>! <StartAction>[He tosses you a wink.]</Start> Well thank you for your help all the same. Now forgive me, <man/woman> of riches, but I must get back to work on my creations...
<StartAction>[Success]</Start> What? That should teach me not to send the wealthy Magistrate's <CUSTOM6001> to do my haggling for me, shouldn't it... Very well, it's worth the money even then.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Oof! You've got to learn to haggle better, <FirstName>. Honestly, you walk around like you've got all your father's treasury tied at your waste.
<StartAction>[Success]</Start> What? That should teach me not to send the wealthy Magistrate's <CUSTOM6001> to do my haggling for me, shouldn't it... Very well, it's worth the money even then.

<StartAction>[Janthos hands you a pouch of gold.]</Start> Once again, thank you for your help, <FirstName>, but I must get back to work! With a little luck, I can have these constructs on their way to new, improved heights by the end of the day!
<StartAction>[Janthos looks up from his tinkering with the construct before him.]</Start> Ah, I wondered where you wandered off to, <FirstName>! What's going on?
Then I should get back to my work. Maybe go distract Alia for a while. She's been standing there staring daggers at me all <quarterday>.

I wish I had the time for pleasantries, but I really must get some work done on my constructs, <FirstName>. Maybe go distract Alia for a while. She's been standing there staring daggers at me all <quarterday>.
Irilium, eh? Well, now, I suppose that may just work! Don't know why I didn't think of that myself! Only problem with Irilium, though, is that the crystals are a bit hard to come by in these parts.

If you happen to come by any Irilium Crystals, I would be more than happy to reimburse you for them. It certainly would save me a great deal of time and aggravation. Check the Market District: I've found all manner of strange things there over the years.
Yes, yes, please do. Now, where was I... <StartAction>[Janthos returns once more to his tinkering.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Janthos motions grandly towards the huge construct beside him as you approach.]</Start>

Haha! I'd like to introduce you to my latest creation, <Lord/Lady> <LastName>... Or is that citizen <LastName> now? Anyway, I made a magnificent breakthrough today and have finally managed to give one of my creations the ability to speak!

Fine then! If you do not want to see history in the making, be my guest, <FirstName>. <StartAction>[With a great huff, the little Gnome turns back to his tinkering, muttering something about you being a chip off the old block.]</Start>
Bah! You've been spending too much time with Alia again. I'm on the verge of something here, I can feel it.
Well, it serves as a guide to visitors coming and going from the Imperial District... but that will only be the beginning, I assure you!
That it is, my friend! This construct will serve as a guide for visitors to the Imperial District... but that will only be the beginning, I assure you!

At the moment, these constructs rely solely on the power of the Control Stone, located in the Grand Hall. While the Control Stone allows the constructs to perform at a considerable level, it doesn't have the strength to utilize their full potential.

I have been working on several experiments to find a power source capable of containing the potent magic necessary to enhance the constructs' abilities but, as of yet, I have not found one to suit my purposes.

<StartAction>[Janthos does not seem to even hear you bid your farewell, for he has already returned to his work...]</Start> Now, let's try this... No, no, that doesn't work... <StartAction>[You decide to leave the Gnome to his work.]</Start>
I hope so, <FirstName>. I've saved up some gold from what the city's given me for my past work. If cost is ever the issue, I can more than cover it and leave you some left over, all right?
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> <StartAction>[You carefully examine the construct before you but are unable to make sense of Janthos' work. He clearly holds more talent in this area than you.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Success] [You kneel to examine the runes covering the construct, noting the paths of the magical energy coursing through it.]</Start>

<StartAction>[Success]</Start> Irilium, eh? Well, now, I suppose that may just work! Don't know why I didn't think of that myself! Only problem with Irilium, though, is that the crystals are a bit hard to come by in these parts.
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 0. >>
<< This conversation node does nothing but reset the variable "N_TALK_SWITCH" >>
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_JANTHOS" >>
This is all your fault, Janthos!
There isn't anything you can do about it now...
Don't blame yourself, Janthos...
What about the Irilium Crystals, Janthos?
Not yet. I'll see what I can do.
Irilium Crystals? Yeah, I have some...
Those crystals cost me a pretty penny...
Just be careful, all right?
I was glad to be of assistance, Janthos.
Don't be foolish. It was my father's money anyway.
That sounds fair.
<StartAction>[Persuade]</Start> Actually, they cost me 150...
<StartAction>[Persuade]</Start> Actually, they cost me 200...
Nothing at the moment.
Just thought I'd say hello.
Have you tried Irilium as a power source?
I'll see what I can do.
I don't have time for this, all right?
That's, uh... creepy, Janthos... Creepy...
Does it have anything interesting to say?
That's certainly quite the achievement.
I'd better leave you to your tinkerings, Janthos.
Perhaps I can find you a suitable power source.
<StartAction>[Spellcraft] [Examine the golem yourself.]</Start>
Have you tried Irilium?
<StartAction>[Lore]</Start> What about Irilium?
